name: Google STEP Internship
description: Software engineering internship for first and second-year undergraduate students.
eligibility: First or second-year CS students at accredited universities.

name: Microsoft Explore Program
description: 12-week internship for first and second-year students exploring software engineering and PM.
eligibility: First or second-year undergraduates in CS or related fields.

name: Meta University Program
description: Internship for underrepresented students interested in software engineering.
eligibility: First or second-year undergraduates from underrepresented groups in tech.

name: MLH Fellowship
description: 12-week remote program for aspiring software engineers contributing to open source projects.
eligibility: Students or recent graduates with programming experience.

name: Outreachy
description: Paid remote internships in open source for people underrepresented in tech.
eligibility: People subject to systemic bias or underrepresentation in tech. No prior experience needed.

name: Google Summer of Code (GSoC)
description: Global program to bring new contributors into open source software development.
eligibility: Open source beginners 18+. Students and non-students welcome.

name: Amazon Future Engineer Internship
description: Software development engineering internship focused on increasing diversity in tech.
eligibility: First or second-year CS students from underrepresented backgrounds.

name: Jane Street Internship
description: Quantitative trading and technology internship at a leading trading firm.
eligibility: Strong math/CS background. All levels welcome.

name: Two Sigma Internship
description: Software engineering and quantitative research internship.
eligibility: Undergraduate or graduate students in CS, math, or related fields.

name: Palantir Path Internship
description: Software engineering internship for students early in their CS journey.
eligibility: First or second-year undergraduates in CS or related fields.

name: MIT MSRP (MIT Summer Research Program)
description: 10-week summer research experience at MIT for underrepresented minority students.
eligibility: US citizens or permanent residents from underrepresented groups. Non-MIT juniors/seniors.

name: Stanford SURF (Summer Undergraduate Research Fellowship)
description: 8-week summer research program at Stanford for undergraduates interested in research.
eligibility: Undergraduates at US institutions. Priority to underrepresented groups.

name: Caltech SURF (Summer Undergraduate Research Fellowships)
description: 10-week research fellowship at Caltech collaborating with faculty and researchers.
eligibility: Undergraduates at any institution (including international). Minimum 3.2 GPA.

name: CERN Openlab Summer Student Programme
description: 9-week summer program working on advanced computing projects at CERN.
eligibility: Undergraduate or masters students in CS, engineering, or physics.

name: CERN Summer Student Programme
description: 8-13 week program at CERN working on physics, engineering, or computing projects.
eligibility: Undergraduates or early-career masters students in STEM fields.

name: Max Planck Summer Internship
description: Summer research internships at various Max Planck Institutes across Germany.
eligibility: Undergraduate or masters students in relevant STEM fields.

name: DAAD RISE (Research Internships in Science and Engineering)
description: Summer research internships at German universities and research institutions.
eligibility: Undergraduate students in STEM from North American, British, and Irish universities.

name: Amgen Scholars Program
description: Summer research program at world-class institutions in USA, Europe, Asia, and Australia.
eligibility: Undergraduates in biology, chemistry, or related fields.

name: RIPS (Research in Industrial Projects for Students)
description: 8-week research program at UCLA solving real-world problems for industry sponsors.
eligibility: Undergraduate math/CS students (international applicants welcome).

name: Santa Fe Institute Undergraduate Complexity Research
description: 10-week summer research program in complex systems science.
eligibility: Undergraduates in any quantitative field. International students welcome.

name: Kaggle Competitions
description: Data science and machine learning competitions with real-world datasets.
eligibility: Open to everyone worldwide. No restrictions.

name: Zindi Competitions
description: Africa's largest data science competition platform solving African challenges.
eligibility: Open to everyone. Many competitions are Africa-specific.

name: Google Code Jam
description: Algorithmic programming competition hosted by Google.
eligibility: Open to all ages and experience levels worldwide.

name: ICPC (International Collegiate Programming Contest)
description: World's oldest and most prestigious programming competition for university students.
eligibility: Enrolled university students (teams of 3). Age limit applies.

name: International Mathematics Olympiad (IMO)
description: The world championship mathematics competition for pre-university students.
eligibility: Pre-university students under 20 who haven't begun university. Selected through national olympiad.

name: International Science Olympiad
description: International competitions in Physics (IPhO), Chemistry (IChO), Biology (IBO), Informatics (IOI).
eligibility: Secondary school students selected through national olympiad rounds.

name: Hult Prize
description: World's largest student social entrepreneurship competition.
eligibility: University students worldwide (teams of 3-4).

name: NASA Space Apps Challenge
description: Annual international hackathon using NASA's open data to solve challenges.
eligibility: Open to everyone worldwide. No experience required.

name: Microsoft Imagine Cup
description: Global technology competition for student developers and entrepreneurs.
eligibility: Students 16+ enrolled in accredited educational institution.

name: ACM SIGCHI Student Research Competition
description: Research competitions at major ACM conferences for undergraduate and graduate students.
eligibility: Current undergraduate or graduate students with research to present.

name: GitHub Campus Expert Program
funding: Swag + training + conference access + GitHub Pro
description: Program to train student community leaders in technical community building.
eligibility: Students 18+ enrolled in higher education. Must be a community leader.

name: Google Developer Student Club (GDSC) Lead
description: University-based community groups powered by Google for student developers.
eligibility: Undergraduate or graduate students passionate about Google technology.

name: Microsoft Learn Student Ambassador
funding: Azure credits + certification vouchers + swag + LinkedIn Premium
description: Global program to empower student leaders who want to make a difference.
eligibility: Students 16+ enrolled in accredited institution.

name: Millennium Fellowship (United Nations)
description: Semester-long leadership development program addressing UN Sustainable Development Goals.
eligibility: Undergraduate students at partner universities worldwide.

name: Obama Foundation Leaders Program
funding: Full tuition + living + travel at Columbia/UChicago
description: Programs for emerging leaders from Africa, Asia-Pacific, and Europe.
eligibility: Emerging civic leaders with demonstrated community impact.

name: Mandela Washington Fellowship (YALI)
description: Flagship program of the Young African Leaders Initiative for outstanding young African leaders.
eligibility: African citizens aged 25-35 with leadership track record.

name: Chevening Fellowships
funding: Short-term funded program at UK institutions
description: Short professional fellowships at UK institutions for mid-career professionals.
eligibility: Mid-career professionals from eligible countries with 5+ years experience.

name: Resolution Fellowship
description: Supports socially-responsible undergraduate ventures through funding and mentorship.
eligibility: Undergraduate students launching social ventures. Apply at partner conferences.

name: Talloires Network Fellowship
description: For university students leading community engagement projects.
eligibility: Undergraduates at member universities engaged in civic engagement.

name: DeepMind Summer School
description: Intensive program covering advanced topics in AI and machine learning.
eligibility: Graduate students and researchers in ML/AI.

name: Oxford Machine Learning Summer School (OxML)
organization: University of Oxford + AI for Global Goals
description: Week-long program on fundamentals and advanced ML topics taught by world experts.
eligibility: Students, researchers, and professionals in ML/AI. Scholarships for developing countries.

name: EPFL Summer Research Program
description: 8-week research internship at one of Europe's top technical universities.
eligibility: Undergraduate students in STEM (2nd year or later). International applicants welcome.

name: LSE Summer School
description: 3-week intensive courses in social sciences, economics, law, and more.
eligibility: University students, graduates, and professionals. Bursaries for developing countries.

name: Heidelberg Laureate Forum
description: One-week event where young researchers meet laureates in math and CS (Abel, Fields, Turing).
eligibility: PhD students, postdocs, or outstanding masters students in math or CS.

name: Lisbon Machine Learning Summer School (LxMLS)
description: One-week intensive school covering NLP and machine learning.
eligibility: Graduate students, researchers, and industry professionals.

name: Eastern European Machine Learning Summer School (EEML)
description: Week-long school on deep learning featuring top researchers.
eligibility: Graduate students and early-career researchers. Priority for Eastern European students.

name: Neuromatch Academy
description: Free online computational neuroscience and deep learning summer school.
eligibility: Open to anyone worldwide. Completely free.

name: African Machine Intelligence (AfriML) Workshop
description: Workshops and summer schools focused on AI development for and by Africans.
eligibility: Open to African students, researchers, and professionals.

name: AFS Intercultural Programs
description: Cultural exchange programs for high school and gap year students in 60+ countries.
eligibility: Students aged 15-18 (school programs) or 18+ (volunteer programs).

name: United World Colleges (UWC)
funding: Need-based scholarships (many students attend fully funded)
description: Two-year pre-university International Baccalaureate at 18 schools worldwide.
eligibility: Students aged 16-19. Apply through Ghana national committee. Selection is merit and values-based.

name: Kennedy-Lugar YES Program
funding: Fully funded (flights + host family + school fees + insurance)
description: Academic year exchange program for high school students from countries with significant Muslim populations.
eligibility: High school students aged 15-17 from eligible countries. Must maintain good grades.

name: NSLI-Y (National Security Language Initiative for Youth)
description: Scholarship program for US high schoolers to learn critical languages abroad.
eligibility: US high school students aged 15-18.

name: AIESEC Global Volunteer
description: Cross-cultural volunteer experiences in 120+ countries lasting 6-8 weeks.
eligibility: University students and recent graduates aged 18-30.

name: Erasmus+ International Credit Mobility
description: Semester or year exchange at European partner universities.
eligibility: Students at universities with Erasmus+ partnership agreements.

name: Global UGRAD Exchange Program
funding: Fully funded (tuition + housing + meals + flights + stipend)
description: One-semester exchange at a US university for undergraduates from developing countries.
eligibility: Undergraduate students from eligible countries with strong English skills.

name: Schwarzman Scholars
funding: Full tuition + room + board + travel + stipend
description: One-year masters in Global Affairs at Tsinghua University in Beijing.
eligibility: Bachelor's degree holders aged 18-28 with leadership experience.

name: Teach For All Fellowship
description: 2-year teaching fellowship in under-resourced schools. Build leadership while making impact.
eligibility: Recent graduates or professionals with strong academic record and leadership.

name: Data Science Africa
description: Annual workshop and summer school bringing together data scientists across Africa.
eligibility: Students, researchers, and practitioners in data science from Africa.

name: Google HashCode
description: Team programming competition solving Google engineering problems.
eligibility: Open to all. Teams of 2-4 members.

name: TopCoder Open
description: Competitive programming, data science, and design challenges.
eligibility: Open to all skill levels worldwide.

name: Africa Prize for Engineering Innovation
description: Annual prize celebrating innovative engineering talent in Sub-Saharan Africa.
eligibility: African engineers and innovators with scalable innovations addressing local challenges.

name: McKinsey Forward Program
description: Free online capability-building program covering problem-solving and digital skills.
eligibility: Early-career professionals (0-10 years experience). Open globally.

name: Apple Software Engineering Internship
description: Software engineering internship at Apple.
eligibility: Enrolled CS students at accredited universities.

name: Spotify Engineering Internship
description: Backend, frontend, or data engineering internship.

name: Netflix Engineering Internship

eligibility: Enrolled undergraduate or graduate CS students.

name: Stripe Engineering Internship

name: Airbnb Engineering Internship

name: Uber Engineering Internship

name: DeepMind Research Internship

name: OpenAI Research Internship
